sect2.title: Basic Enumerations
sect2.para: Enumerations are a restricting layer on top of classes and class constants, intended to provide a way to define a closed set of possible values for a type.

informalexample.programlisting:
<?php
enum Suit
{
    case Hearts;
    case Diamonds;
    case Clubs;
    case Spades;
}

function do_stuff(Suit $s)
{
    // ...
}

do_stuff(Suit::Spades);
?>

sect2.simpara: For a full discussion, see the Enumerations chapter.

sect2.title: Casting
sect2.para: If an enum is converted to an object, it is not modified. If an enum is converted to an array, an array with a single name key (for Pure enums) or an array with both name and value keys (for Backed enums) is created. All other cast types will result in an error.
